lines.text: [first title card]

For childhood, Saturday - free from school - is the most changeless of institutions - whether it is in city or village, or main street, or in those vital, teeming streets which were the Brooklyn of a few decades ago.
[last lines]
Neeley ...
Uh-huh?
Am I good-looking?
Aw, what's eatin' ya?
No, honest, Neeley, I wanna know.

[after considering her for a few moments]
You'll pass.
You're sweet, Neeley.
Aw, cut the mush.
Flossie Gaddis died last night.
The poor baby. It was nice that her Mama got her all them pretty dresses.
lines.character: Johnny Nolan aka The Brooklyn Thrush

lines.text: Only now the poor thing will have to lie in Potter's Field!
But at least she had the dresses!
lines.character: Johnny Nolan aka The Brooklyn Thrush

lines.text:
[Johnny has promised to get Francie enrolled in the school she admires.]
Bend down Papa.
[He does.]
My cup runneth over.
Out the window, our tree they killed it!
Well, would you like at that now.
lines.character: Johnny Nolan aka The Brooklyn Thrush

lines.text: They didn't have any right to kill it did they papa!
Now wait a minute. They didn't kill it. Why they couldn't kill that tree.
lines.character: Johnny Nolan aka The Brooklyn Thrush

lines.text: Promise?

Why sure baby. Don't tell me that tree is gonna lay down and die that easily. Look at that tree. See where it's coming from. Right up outta that cement! Didn't nobody plant it. Didn't ask the cement to grow. It just couldn't help growing so much it just pushed that old cement out of the way. Now when you bust it with something like that, can't anybody help it, like... like that little ole bird up there. He didn't ask anybody could he sing and he certainly didn't take any lessons. He's so full of singing it just has to bust out someplace. Why they could cut that ole tree right down to the ground and a root would push up someplace else in the cement.
lines.character: Johnny Nolan aka The Brooklyn Thrush

lines.text: Mama says not to be too late, Papa.
Look, God invented time and when He invents something, there's always plenty of it.
lines.character: Johnny Nolan aka The Brooklyn Thrush

lines.text: [first lines]
This'll be the last of them now, Francie.
